SEARCH
Package org.rcmd.jneuroformats

Class Mesh

java.lang.Object
org.rcmd.jneuroformats.Mesh
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMesh
public class Mesh extends Object implements IMesh
Class representing a 3D mesh, with vertices and faces. The mesh is assumed to be made of triangular faces.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Mesh.MeshFileFormat
    Enumeration of supported mesh file formats.
    protected static class

    Models the header information from an ASCII PLY file.

      Constructor that takes a list of vertices and a list of faces.
      Parameters:
      vertices - the mesh vertices, as x,y,z coordinates.
      faces - the mesh faces, as indices into the vertex list. The mesh is assumed to be triangular.

      public void setVertices(List<float[]> vertices)
      Set the vertices of the mesh. Does not change the faces, you have to ensure consistency yourself.

      Parameters:
      vertices - the new vertices.

    • getMeshFileFormat

      protected static Mesh.MeshFileFormat getMeshFileFormat(Path filePath, String format) throws IOException
      Get the mesh file format from the file path and format string.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file
      format - the format string
      Returns:
      the mesh file format
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs

    • write

      public void write(Path filePath, String format) throws IOException
      Write this mesh to a file in PLY, OBJ or FreeSurfer surf format.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file to write to
      format - the format to write to, either "ply", "obj", or "surf". Alternatively, "auto" to derive the format from the filePath.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • read

      public static Mesh read(Path filePath) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Read a file in MZ3, PLY, or FreeSurfer mesh format and return an FsSurface object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.ply")`. The file format will be determined from the file extension.
      Returns:
      an FsSurface object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
      See Also:
      • if you want to read a file and specify the format.

    • readFormat

      public static Mesh readFormat(Path filePath, String format) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Read a file in MZ3, PLY, or FreeSurfer mesh format and return an FsSurface object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.mgz")`. The file format will be determined from the file extension if parameter `format` is set to `auto`.
      format - the file format to read, either "mz3", "ply", "surf", or "auto" to auto-detect from the file name.
      Returns:
      an FsSurface object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
      See Also:
      • if you want to read a file without specifying the format.

    • fromMz3File

      public static Mesh fromMz3File(Path filePath) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException, BufferUnderflowException
      Read a file in MZ3 surface format and return an FsSurface object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.mz3")`.
      Returns:
      an FsSurface object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if file not found.
      BufferUnderflowException - if buffer underflow occurs, i.e., the file is too short to read the first header part required to determine the file format.

    • fromPlyFile

      public static Mesh fromPlyFile(Path filePath) throws IOException
      Read a file in ASCII PLY format and return a FsSurface object. Skips vertex colors and normals, if any.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.ply")`.
      Returns:
      an FsSurface object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • parsePlyHeader

      protected static Mesh.PlyHeaderInfo parsePlyHeader(List<String> plyLines, Path filePath) throws IOException
      Parse information from the header lines of a PLY file, ASCII version.
      Parameters:
      plyLines - the lines of the PLY file, as a list of strings.
      filePath - the path to the PLY file, as a Path object. Only used in error messages, as we already have the plyLines.
      Returns:
      a PlyHeaderInfo object containing the parsed information.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • getListIndexStringStartingWith

      protected static int getListIndexStringStartingWith(List<String> lines, String prefix)
      Utility function to find index of line starting with a given prefix in a list of strings.
      Parameters:
      lines - the list of strings to search in.
      prefix - the prefix to search for.
      Returns:
      the index of the first line starting with the given prefix, or -1 if no such line exists.

    • toPlyFormat

      public String toPlyFormat()
      Generate string representation of this mesh in PLY format.
      Returns:
      the PLY format string

    • toPlyFormat

      public String toPlyFormat(List<Color> vertexColors)
      Generate string representation of this mesh in PLY format, with vertex colors.
      Parameters:
      vertexColors - the vertex colors to use, as a list of `java.awt.color` instances.
      Returns:
      the PLY format string

    • toObjFormat

      public String toObjFormat()
      Generate string representation of this mesh in Wavefront Object (OBJ) format.
      Returns:
      the OBJ format string
